intro: Maesa pahangiana, commonly known as the Pahang maesa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Malaysia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and other ericaceous plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
